meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strange or mysterious.
meanings.sent1: The uncanniness of the old house made me shiver.
meanings.sent2: The uncanniness of the situation left us all feeling uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The uncanniness of the talking cat caught us off guard.
meanings.sent4: The uncanniness of the fog blanketing the town was like a ghostly embrace.
meanings.sent5: The uncanniness of the abandoned carnival was etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being uncomfortably strange or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the uncanniness of the new school.
meanings.sent2: The uncanniness of the dark alley made her walk faster.
meanings.sent3: The uncanniness of the clown's smile made everyone chuckle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The uncanniness of the silence in the room was deafening.
meanings.sent5: The uncanniness of the mirror reflection seemed to mimic her every move.
